column2: KANSAS DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
column4: Kansas
column6: KS

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: there is a winding road ahead.
column6: the highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways. Drivers should keep to the right.
column8: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Divided highway ahead
column6: Four-lane traffic ahead
column8: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 3. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column6: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column8: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.

column2: 4. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.
column8: The same as a steady yellow light.

column2: 5. The yield sign means:
column4: Slow down and give vehicles crossing your path the right-of-way.
column6: Drive with caution in wet weather.
column8: You must come to a complete stop.

column2: 6. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column8: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 7. The extra space in front of a large truck is needed for:
column4: other drivers when merging onto a freeway.
column6: the truck driver to stop the vehicle.
column8: other drivers when they want to pass the truck.

column2: 8. When passing a pedestrian who is walking on the road and an oncoming vehicle is approaching, you should:
column4: honk your horn to warn the pedestrian.
column6: keep driving, you have the right-of-way.
column8: slow down and let the vehicle pass first.

column2: 9. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on public roads
column6: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column8: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 10. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column4: on multiple lane highways.
column6: at most intersections.
column8: in school zones.

column2: 11. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column4: Drivers who are driving alone.
column6: Young people.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 12. If the roadway is wet, you should:
column4: reduce your speed.
column6: maintain the same speed.
column8: increase your speed.

column2: 13. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

column2: 14. When is the pavement most slippery?
column4: When it has just begun to rain.
column6: When it's been raining from at least one hour.
column8: If it's been raining several hours.

column2: 15. This sign indicates that:
column4: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column6: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column8: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.

column2: 16. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: No U-turns
column8: No left turn

column2: 17. If a pedestrian is illegal crossing in the middle of the street (not at a crosswalk) you:
column4: should increase your speed, honk your horn and proceed.
column6: must stop for them.
column8: do not have to stop for them.

column2: 18. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: increase your speed immediately.
column8: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 19. The best way to deal with tailgaters is to:
column4: flash your brake lights.
column6: let them pass if it's safe to do so.
column8: always keep your eyes focused ahead of your car.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: U-turns are prohibited
column6: Drivers may proceed if the way is clear
column8: Drivers are about to enter a one way street the wrong way

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column4: No right turn
column6: No left turn
column8: No U-turns

column2: 22. Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
column4: unless you have the right-of-way.
column6: under any circumstances.
column8: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

column2: 23. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.
column8: wear approved helmets.

column2: 24. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: on the left shoulder of the road.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are permitted
column6: Right turn is not permitted
column8: You may turn right after yielding the right-of-way to oncoming traffic
